title: Fried Garlic Pizza Sauce
servings: MAKES ABOUT 3 CUPS (700 G), ENOUGH FOR 2 SHEET-PAN PIZZAS OR 4 BAR PIES
ingredients: One 28-ounce (794 g) can whole peeled San Marzano tomatoes
5large garlic cloves, thinly sliced on a mandoline
Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
directions: 1. Add the tomatoes to a blender, and blend until they’re broken down slightly but still chunky.
2. Add the olive oil and garlic to a small sauté pan. Set over medium-low heat, and fry the garlic, stirring constantly, until lightly golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
3. Pour the garlic and oil into the blender with the tomatoes. Stir with a spoon to incorporate the oil with the tomatoes. (Blending before stirring may cause the sauce to shoot out of the blender.)
4. Add the tomato paste and oregano, and blend until smooth.
6. This sauce can be made up to 3 days in advance and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator. It also can be stored in the freezer for up to 4 months.
